summary: This is an email chain from December 2018 between SDNY prosecutors discussing a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The chain includes forwarded emails from Skinner providing documents and a news article about Epstein's continued relationships with young women.

persons.name: Kurland, Abigail
persons.context: Appears as a recipient in the email chain among SDNY prosecutors discussing Epstein-related information.

persons.name: Kramer, Amanda
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor who is asked about notes from a meeting with Peter Skinner regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Attorney who met with SDNY prosecutors in 2016, provided documents related to Epstein/Maxwell cases, and forwarded a news article about Epstein.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Lead attorney on the case referenced by Peter Skinner, added to the email chain for follow-up.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation and news article discussing his continued relationships with young women.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a defamation case mentioned in attached documents; her motion to dismiss was denied.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: Appears as a recipient in the 2016 email from Peter Skinner.

persons.name: Brad
persons.context: Appears as a recipient in the 2016 email from Peter Skinner (likely Brad Edwards).

connections.description: Skinner identifies McCawley as a lead attorney on the case and includes her in communications.
Skinner is providing case documents and information to prosecutors regarding Epstein.
Skinner describes McCawley as a lead attorney on the case involving Epstein.
Maxwell is referenced in the defamation case related to Epstein's activities.
Kramer met with Skinner regarding Epstein and took notes/documents.

events.title: PageSix article on Epstein
events.description: PageSix reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, mentioning his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Meeting between Skinner and SDNY
events.description: Peter Skinner meets with SDNY prosecutors (likely including Amanda Kramer) to discuss Epstein case and provides documents.

events.title: Judge Sweet denies Maxwell's motion
events.description: Judge Sweet denies Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in the defamation case against her.

events.title: SDNY follow-up on Epstein information
events.description: SDNY prosecutors exchange emails trying to locate notes and documents from the 2016 meeting with Peter Skinner.

keyFacts: In March 2016, PageSix reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, specifically mentioning his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.
Attorney Peter Skinner provided SDNY prosecutors with case documents including a complaint against Ghislaine Maxwell, declarations in a CVRA case, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302.
Judge Sweet denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case on February 29, 2016.
SDNY prosecutors were actively gathering information about Epstein in December 2018, seeking notes from a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner.
